intro: Peucedanum connatum, commonly known as the European cowparsley, is a biennial herb native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers in umbels. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found along riverbanks and in meadows. The seeds are enclosed in a ribbed, dry fruit and are dispersed by wind.
